text:
Rueppel's big-eyed tree frog ("Nyctimystes rueppelli") is a tree frog from Indonesia. It lives on Halmahera and Morotai Islands in the Moluccas. It lives in forests and wetlands not near the ocean.
Scientists looked at dead, preserved frogs. A male frog was 4.8 cm long. A female frog was 4.0 cm long. When alive, this frog is yellow with black marks. This frog has up-and-down marks on its lower eyelids.
